title: High Gross Savings Rate
description: In 2023, Indonesia's gross savings reached 7,510,595,299,407,600 LCU, indicating a strong savings culture and financial stability.

title: Significant Manufacturing Sector
description: Indonesia's manufacturing value added was 2,507,799,800,000,000 LCU in 2023, showcasing its robust industrial base.

title: Operational Efficiency in Utility Services
description: In 2024, Indonesia scored 98.96 in the operational efficiency of utility service provision, reflecting effective management and service delivery.

title: High Gross Fixed Capital Formation
description: In 2023, Indonesia's gross fixed capital formation was 3,848,715,980,745,210 LCU, indicating substantial investment in infrastructure and development.

title: Low Trained Teachers in Preprimary Education
description: In 2023, only 3.22% of preprimary teachers in Indonesia were trained, highlighting a significant gap in early childhood education quality.

title: High Prevalence of Tobacco Use Among Males
description: In 2022, 73.1% of male adults in Indonesia were current tobacco users, posing a major public health challenge.

title: Negative Net Primary Income
description: In 2023, Indonesia had a net primary income of -537,935,133,823,997 LCU, indicating more income is paid abroad than received.

title: High CO2 Emissions from Land Use
description: In 2022, Indonesia's CO2 net fluxes from land use were 924.85 Mt CO2e, contributing significantly to global emissions.

title: Low Aid from France and Netherlands
description: In 2022, Indonesia received negative net bilateral aid flows from France and the Netherlands, totaling -123,669,998.17 and -4,800,000.19 US$, respectively.
